title: Neuroevolution Flappy Bird
description: In this challenge, I use my JavaScript neural network library and a genetic algorithm to train an agent to play Flappy Bird.

timestamps.title: Introducing today's topic: Flappy Birds
Pieces of the Code
Reinforcement Learning
Make multiple birds that make random decisions and use a genetic alorithm
Each Bird object will have its own neural network "brain"
The architecture for the neural network
Write a think function
Code the inputs
Find the closest pipe
Summary and next steps
Part 2 - Incorporate a genetic algorithm
Make a population of birds
Delete a bird if it hits a pipe
Write a function for the next generation
Evaluate the fitness value for each bird
Pick a new bird
Write a mutate function
Pick a new bird based on its fitness
Conclusion and next steps
Part 3 of Flappy Bird - More Improvements
Separate the game logic from the drawing
Add a slider to control the number of cycles
Mutate the fitness score by a random Gaussian number
Conclusion and possible ways to optimize the genetic algorithm

parts.title: Part 4 - Incorporate Features Suggested on Github

timestamps.title: Part 4 - Incorporate features suggested on Github
Add y velocity to the inputs
Fixing the algorithm that detects the closest pipe
Remove a bird when it hits the bottom
Make game harder by decreasing the spacing between the pipes
Optional feature: a bird can only jump if moving down
Conclusion and goal of the last part of this challenge
Part 5 - Save/Load a Bird
Use SaveJSON to save the weights of the neural network
Save the weights of the best bird
Remove genetic algorithm and load the neural network of the best bird
Load a "good" and a "bad" bird and compare their collisions
Conclusion and possibilities for refinements
